New Records: Trey Sweeney had four hits, including a home run
Key Match Events: Detroit Tigers beat the Oakland Athletics 9-1
Lawrence Butler's fifth-inning single was the A's first hit, and it also extended his career-best hit streak to 18 games
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers, looking to make a late rally in the AL Wild Card race, took two out of three in Oakland and are two games above.500
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said that Madden was “calm” and a “huge competitor,” delivering when the bullpen was taxed from a 13-inning game earlier in the series
A's manager Mark Kotsay said that the last homestand — from Sept. 20 to 26 — will be “tough”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The A’s will play their home games in Sacramento next season ahead of a planned move to Las Vegas in 2028
The Tigers are planning to rehab shortstop Javier Báez in Detroit but plans to spend time around the team the remainder of the season
